job_description: Job Description:This position requires office presence of a minimum of 5 days per week and is only located in the location(s) posted. No relocation is offered.Join AT&T and help shape the future of communications and technology that connect the world. We value innovators who seek to explore the unknown and challenge the status quo. Bring your bold ideas and fearless spirit to redefine connectivity and transform how people share stories and experiences. At AT&T, you won’t just imagine the future—you’ll build it.We are seeking a Member of Technical Staff (Full Stack Developer) to join our small, collaborative team driving AT&T’s Network Systems Transformation by leveraging AI and machine learning (AI/ML) to advance service assurance and network testing solutions.What you'll do:In this role, you will work across both front-end and back-end systems to modernize legacy applications and develop new, AI/ML-powered tools that restore network performance, automate testing, and streamline troubleshooting for network technicians.You will contribute to both existing and emerging network testing platforms, building innovative, cloud-based solutions that align with AT&T’s strategic technology roadmap and support future initiatives.This position requires a balance of maintaining and enhancing legacy systems while continuously applying the latest AI/ML techniques to deliver resilient, efficient, and scalable network testing services.As part of the team, you will participate in an on-call rotation to support critical software, and collaborate in small sub-teams to address evolving business needs, ensuring AT&T remains at the forefront of next-generation network technology.What you’ll bring:PhD in an approved field from an approved university with no experience, or a Masters in an approved field from an approved university with a minimum of 1 year of relevant experience, or a Bachelors in an approved field from an approved university with a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience. R Our Senior Member of Technical Staff, earns between $148,200-$222,400 USD Annual, Not to mention all the other amazing rewards that working at AT&T offers. Individual starting salary within this range may depend on geography, experience, expertise, and education/training. Joining our team comes with amazing perks and benefits:Medical/Dental/Vision coverage 401(k) plan Tuition reimbursement program Paid Time Off and Holidays (based on date of hire, at least 23 days of vacation each year and 9 company-designated holidays) Paid Parental Leave Paid Caregiver Leave Additional sick leave beyond what state and local law require may be available but is unprotected Adoption Reimbursement Disability Benefits (short term and long term) Life and Accidental Death Insurance Supplemental benefit programs: critical illness/accident hospital indemnity/group legal Employee Assistance Programs (EAP) Extensive employee wellness programs Employee discounts up to 50% off on eligible AT&T mobility plans and accessories,AT&T internet (and fiber where available) and AT&T phone.#LI-Onsite – Full-time office role-Ready to join our team? Apply today.Weekly Hours:40Time Type:RegularLocation:Middletown, New JerseySalary Range: $148,200.00 - $222,400.00It is the policy of AT&T to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, AT&T will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. AT&T is a fair chance employer and does not initiate a background check until an offer is made.

job_description: Job DescriptionGM does not provide immigration-related sponsorship for this role. Do not apply for this role if you will need GM immigration sponsorship now or in the future. This includes direct company sponsorship, entry of GM as the immigration employer of record on a government form, and any work authorization requiring a written submission or other immigration support from the company (e.g., H1-B, OPT, STEM OPT, CPT, TN, J-1, etc.)To help facilitate administration of relocation benefits if you are selected, please apply using the permanent address you would move from.Work Arrangement: Hybrid: This role is categorized as hybrid. This means the successful candidate is expected to report to the office three times per week, at minimum. The Team: At General Motors, our Mainframe Ecosystem team is expanding and looking for talented individuals to join our Software Development and Platform Engineering groups. These teams play a vital role in GM’s ongoing Mainframe Transformation, delivering horizontal shared services that enable modern software and systems engineering practices.Our applications run on a modern Parallel Sysplex, supporting advanced tools, products, and modernization initiativesGlobal Impact: Work on projects that span the globe, touching every aspect of our business and technology units.Cutting-Edge Technology: Be part of a team driving the transformation of GM’s mainframe ecosystem with future AI projects on the horizon.Collaborative Environment: Thrive in a supportive, Agile workplace that values innovation and teamwork.Career Growth: Gain hands-on experience with real-world projects and receive continuous training to develop your skills.What You’ll Do:As a Systems Engineer at GM, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies in a global organization that values innovation. You’ll help modernize our worldwide technology platform while gaining hands-on experience with impactful, real-world projects. You will be joining a highly collaborative, increasingly Agile environment and take on a key role in shaping the future of the GM Mainframe ecosystem. This position is ideal for someone with strong systems engineering fundamentals, a positive attitude, and a genuine eagerness to learn and grow.We’re seeking creative thinkers who are passionate about technology and excited to make an impact.Responsibilities:Collaborate with global teams, communicating effectively with a positive, solutions-focused mindset.Design and build innovative solutions that address real-world challenges while ensuring quality and timely delivery.Break projects into actionable tasks, estimate timelines accurately, and deliver incremental value.Investigate issues, perform root-cause analysis, and develop quick prototypes to validate solutions.Keep your team updated through regular progress communication.Drive innovation by championing modern engineering practices such as test-driven development, continuous integration, and automated delivery pipelines.Technical Skills – \[Comprehensive Training Provided\]Experience in some (or all) of the following areas. Please note full training will be provided on specific tools, technologies, and processes.Systems Engineer Skills:Agile and Scrum methodologiesCloud computing and VirtualizationNetworking and SecurityOS and Database PlatformsProgramming / scripting / automation toolsMinimum Qualifications:A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and relevant experienceStrong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skillsA proactive mindset with a drive to deliver results and improve processesThe ability to collaborate effectively and build strong working relationshipsA strong technical aptitude and a desire to learn new tools, technologies, and practicesExcellent communication skills and a strong work ethicAble to work full time, 40 hours a weekWhat Will Give You a Competitive Edge (Preferred Qualifications):Experience in one or more of the following technical skillsets:z/OS v2.5 / v3.1IMS / DB2IBM Mainframe Product SetWhat you’ll get from us (Benefits): GM offers a variety of health and wellbeing benefit programs. Benefit options include medical, dental, vision, Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Accounts, retirement savings plan, sickness and accident benefits, life insurance, paid vacation & holidays, tuition assistance programs, employee assistance program, GM vehicle discounts and more.This job may be eligible for relocation benefits. About GMOur vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.Why Join Us We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Every day, we want every employee to feel they belong to one General Motors...

Benefit options include medical, dental, vision, Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Accounts, retirement savings plan, sickness and accident benefits, life insurance, paid vacation & holidays, tuition assistance programs, employee assistance program, GM vehicle discounts and more.This job may be eligible for relocation benefits. About GMOur vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.Why Join Us We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Every day, we want every employee to feel they belong to one General Motors team.Benefits OverviewFrom day one, we're looking out for your well-being–at work and at home–so you can focus on realizing your ambitions. Learn how GM supports a rewarding career that rewards you personally by visiting Total Rewards resources.Non-Discrimination and Equal Employment Opportunities (U.S.)General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of unlawful discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that providing an inclusive workplace creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers.All employment decisions are made on a non-discriminatory basis without regard to sex, race, color, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, disability, pregnancy or maternity status, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran or protected veteran, or any other similarly protected status in accordance with federal, state and local laws. We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications for each role and apply for any positions that match their skills and capabilities. Applicants in the recruitment process may be required, where applicable, to successfully complete a role-related assessment(s) and/or a pre-employment screening prior to beginning employment. To learn more, visit How we Hire.AccommodationsGeneral Motors offers opportunities to all job seekers including individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us or call us at 800-865-7580. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.
